text:
[**Age over 90 **] yo F with CAD s/p CABG in [**2096**] and [**Hospital 11316**] transfered from [**Hospital1 608**] for
   sepsis and CA w/u. The patient reports that she was treated for PNA
   with abx and then thoracentesis two weeks ago.  Pt rpts difficulty
   urinating and recent visit to renal MD. PCP recommended going to [**Hospital1 1074**]
   .
    At [**Hospital3 611**], pt was noted to be in ARF with Cr of 2.5.  She was
   also noted to have leukocytosis. CT abdomen was performed and was
   notable for ascites and diffuse nodular changes in periotoneal cavity
   and on omentum suggesting carcinomatosis.  The stomach is herniated
   into chest cavity.  Left kideny had 1.5 mm lower pole and 5.5 exophytic
   cyst as well as 1mm nonobtracting calculus.  Right kidney had no
   evidence of obstruction.  CT of lungs was significant for collapsed
   left lung with left chest cavity filled with fluid, significant
   compression and collapse of the right lower lobe with large right
   pleural effusion.
   She was also noted to be hypotensive to SBP of 80/50 after CT scan and
   was bolused with fluids.  started on Vanc and Zosyn for presumed sepsis
   and transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for further care.
   .
   In the ED initial vitals were HR 67 BP 79/60 RR 23 and O2 sat: 97% on
   3L NC.  Femoral line placed and levophed started. Admitted to [**Hospital Unit Name 1**] for
   likely sepsis.
   Neuro: alert and orientedx3, not a good historian on medical history.
   Afebrile, c/o abdominal pain in ED was given Maalox w/ good effect.
   Resp: LS diminished, O2 sat 90s on 4L NC. c/o SOB w/ exertion. O2 sat
   dropped to 80s while sleeping and changed to FM @6L, O2 sat 95%.
   CV: arrived on levophed gtt, 0.12mcg, BP 80s-90s. HR 60s and AV paced.
   1L NS bolus given w/ moderate effect.
   GI/GU: foley placed and draining small amount of yellow urine, minimal
   increase with blous. +BS, no stool this shift.  Renal consult if no
   improvement in UO and Creat.
   Access: R femoral TL
   Plan: colonoscopy and transvaginal US when stable to evaluate
   carcinomatosis. Repeat CT scans, films did not come w/ pt form OSH.
   Probable thoracentesis. Cont weaning levophed gtt.
